import React from "react"; const HomeContent = () => { return (

The Bored React Test

Context

I'm a bored developer with approximately an almost null social life. I've decided to build a tool to find some interesting activities to do. I know The Bored API project, so I've decided to build a React App using those APIs. The App Starting from a scratch React App, I want to implement the following features. Home Page This is a static page showing the purpose of this project. It's mainly a static page, with 3 main components: • Header, with menu links • Content • Footer Search Page This is the first page that will use APIs above. Here I would like to build a Form, asking for some filters to retrieve the right activity for today. Filters are: • Activity Type • Activity Participants Since I'm a bored developer, I want also a fancy random button, that will reset all form filters and gives me a random activity. As a result of the search form or the random button, I would like to see the activity in a fancy way, I will demonstrate here all my creativity. Favorite Activities If I found an awesome activity, I would like to add it to my favorite activities. So, I need: • An action to add an activity to my list • An always visible top menu item, that shows the number of my favorite activities and the link to access the page • A new page that shows me my favorite activities Since I know how great is React, I will reuse my fancy Activity component also in this page, to show the list of all my activities (with some adjustments if needed).

); }; export default HomeContent;
